Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2009 09:33AM Juli50 wrote: Chris - A/C only helps to make the stinging go away faster. Once my body heats up, the stinging starts and I have to stop, which means I can't exercise for very long. My favorite form of exercising is tap dancing or line dancing. I tried line dancing a few months ago, the room was very air conditioned and I was under the vent, but I had to quit, it was too painful. I'm beginning to think my only hope is that this is temporary. hugs
Posts.Title: Chemo Sept 08; Let's Shed Weight! Wink Wink

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2009 11:55PM Juli50 wrote: Donna - I can only tread water. If I put my head under, I choke. Are there water exercise classes where you don't have to put your head under? I guess I should check into it. Lisa - I gained weight on Herceptin, but then I got CHF and had to quit. I will be starting Tamoxifen in about a week and am scared I will gain weight again. hugs

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2009 08:55PM Juli50 wrote: I went to visit my tap class tonight. I had to quit when I started chemo. They were so excited to see me and they thought I was coming back to dance, but I had to tell them about the stinging problem. Dancing is the only exercise I enjoy.  They got a big kick out of my curly hair, since the last time I saw them I was bald. LOL hugs
Posts.Title: Chemo Sept 08; Let's Shed Weight! Wink Wink

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2009 09:58AM Juli50 wrote: I have a solution for drinking more water... Effexor. I am taking it for my hot flashes and it makes my mouth so dry that I am drinking water constantly. I noticed I am not as hungry as I used to be and have been losing weight too. yay! Now I just need to start exercising. I can't do much because as soon as I get warmed up, my skin stings. The doctor says I need to exercise to help my heart recover. I am going to go back to walking up/down my stairs again. I can put a fan in the stairway and I need to put up a sign to remind me to do it every day. LOL hugs

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2010 12:16PM Juli50 wrote: Hi all you wonderful May 08 ladies! I have been following you since your inception because I am a Sept 08 chemo gal. You are all so inspiring! A couple of the ladies from my Sept 08 Chemo Group are going on this cruise...   Amoena and Breast Cancer Wellness Magazine sponsor a 7 day, 6 night Breast Cancer Survivor Cruise.  This is their 4th year.  It is May 2-8, 2010 on Carnival Freedom.  It leaves from Fort Lauderdale, Fl and goes to Key West, Cayman Islands and Jamaica.  An interior room is $581 per person - that's less than $100 per day and includes everything.  In addition to the week's cruise, they give out goodie bags, have workshops and speakers - The keynote speaker is Suzie Humphreys, a breast cancer survivor.  Amoena is also sponsoring talks by Dr. Ken Miller of the Lance Armstrong Foundation Cancer Survivorship Clinic, Sherry Lebed-Davis, co-founder of Healthy Steps and Courtney Bugler, Atlanta Young Survival Coalition.  Get all the info from http://www.breastcancerwellness.org/cruise.html   You can register there to win this cruise! It's a great chance to meet each other in person and spend a whole week together! I am also looking for someone to share a room with (so this is why I'm posting here. lol), and promise I am a very nice person. hugs, Juli
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo May 2008 KristyAnn Nico1012
